entry.title: Second Post: Thanksgiving Analysis
entry.summary:
SECOND POST¶

This is the second post in the series
entry.content:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*

*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI colors. */
.ansibold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
/* use dark versions for foreground, to improve visibility */
.ansiblack {
  color: black;
}
.ansired {
  color: darkred;
}
.ansigreen {
  color: darkgreen;
}
.ansiyellow {
  color: #c4a000;
}
.ansiblue {
  color: darkblue;
}
.ansipurple {
  color: darkviolet;
}
.ansicyan {
  color: steelblue;
}
.ansigray {
  color: gray;
}
/* and light for background, for the same reason */
.ansibgblack {
  background-color: black;
}
.ansibgred {
  background-color: red;
}
.ansibggreen {
  background-color: green;
}
.ansibgyellow {
  background-color: yellow;
}
.ansibgblue {
  background-color: blue;
}
.ansibgpurple {
  background-color: magenta;
}
.ansibgcyan {
  background-color: cyan;
}
.ansibggray {
  background-color: gray;
}
div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, transparent -40px, transparent 1px, transparent 1px, transparent 100%);
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #90CAF9;
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
  border-left-width: 0px;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #42A5F5 -40px, #42A5F5 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 100%);
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-width: 0;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #42A5F5 -40px, #42A5F5 7px, #E3F2FD 7px, #E3F2FD 100%);
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
  border-left-width: 0px;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #66BB6A -40px, #66BB6A 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 100%);
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;

}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

*/

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {

}

.rendered_html pre,

}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,

div.text_cell {

  outline: none;

<style type="text/css">.highlight .hll { background-color: #ffffcc }
.highlight  { background: #f8f8f8; }
.highlight .c { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment */
.highlight .err { border: 1px solid #FF0000 } /* Error */
.highlight .k { color: #008000; font-weight: bold } /* Keyword */
.highlight .o { color: #666666 } /* Operator */
.highlight .ch { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Hashbang */
.highlight .cm { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Multiline */
.highlight .cp { color: #BC7A00 } /* Comment.Preproc */
.highlight .cpf { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.PreprocFile */
.highlight .c1 { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Single */
.highlight .cs { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Special */
.highlight .gd { color: #A00000 } /* Generic.Deleted */
.highlight .ge { font-style: italic } /* Generic.Emph */
.highlight .gr { color: #FF0000 } /* Generic.Error */

</div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="SECOND-POST">SECOND POST<a class="anchor-link" href="#SECOND-POST">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This is the second post in the series</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#this is a thanksgiving data analaysis program, a step to data science</span>
<span class="c1">#in this program we want to answer the following question</span>
<span class="c1">#what cooking style can be recommended for a particular choice of food for thanksgiving</span>
<span class="c1">#what kind of food are people most likely to eat during thanksgiving and how many eat each kind</span>
<span class="c1">#what proportion of people celebrate thanksgiving</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="n">thanksgiving</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"thanks.csv"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">engine</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"python"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#use engine=python if encoding error</span>
<span class="n">i_celebrate</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Do you celebrate Thanksgiving?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s2">"Yes"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">i_dont_celebrate</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Do you celebrate Thanksgiving?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s2">"No"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">total_who_celebrate</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_dont_celebrate</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">percentage_who_dont_celebrate</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_dont_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_who_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Proportion of those that dont celebrate is : "</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_dont_celebrate</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">" out of "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_who_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">"persons do not celebrate thanksgiving"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Hence "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">percentage_who_dont_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="si">% d</span><span class="s2">o not celebrate thanksgiving"</span> <span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"1 out of every "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_celebrate</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_dont_celebrate</span><span class="p">)))</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">" persons are ungrateful"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"---Question 3 has been answered----"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"------------****************************question 2************************************-----------------------"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">food_choices</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">food_choices</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">food_choices</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">food_people</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{}</span>
<span class="n">food_styles</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{}</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">food_choices</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">this_c_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">thanksgiving</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">styles_cook</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">this_c_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"How is the main dish typically cooked?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">style</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">styles_cook</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">food_style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">this_c_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">this_c_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"How is the main dish typically cooked?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">num_who_use_this_style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">food_style</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">food_styles</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">style</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">num_who_use_this_style</span>
    <span class="n">num_eat_c</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">this_c_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">food_people</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">num_eat_c</span>

<span class="c1">#countlist=[]</span>
<span class="c1">#for key in food_people:</span>
<span class="c1">#    countlist.append(food_people[key])</span>
<span class="c1">#countlist.remove(859)</span>
<span class="c1">#print(countlist)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"here is the styles for cooking "</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">food_styles</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span>  <span class="o">+</span><span class="s2">" --- "</span><span class="o">+</span>  <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">food_styles</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

<div class="inner_cell">

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"thanksgiving.csv"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">encoding</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"Latin-1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">cat_yes_no</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Do you celebrate Thanksgiving?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">main_dish</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">main_dish_count</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cat_yes_no</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">main_dish_count</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">main_dish_tofurkey</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">main_dish</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s2">"Tofurkey"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">main_dish_tofurkey_yes_no</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">main_dish_tofurkey</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Do you typically have gravy?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">main_dish_tofurkey_yes_no</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="inner_cell">

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="n">apple</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Apple"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">apple_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">apple</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">pumpkin</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Pumpkin"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">pumpkin_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pumpkin</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">pecan</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Pecan"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">pecan_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pecan</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ate_pies</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">apple_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">pumpkin_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">pecan_isnull</span>
<span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"ate_pies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">ate_pies</span>
<span class="n">cat_ate_pies</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"ate_pies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">cat_count</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{}</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">cat_ate_pies</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">this_c</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"ate_pies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">cat_count</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">this_c</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cat_count</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">return_int_agestring</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age_string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age_string</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    <span class="n">age_string</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">age_string</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">" "</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">age_string</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">age_string</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"+"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age_string</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">age_integer</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Age"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">return_int_agestring</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">" "</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>

        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>

<h1 id="figuring-out-most-common-dessert-people-eat,">figuring out most common dessert people eat,<a class="anchor-link" href="#figuring-out-most-common-dessert-people-eat,">¶</a></h1><p>do people eat one or more of:
    Brownies
    Peach cobbler
    Fudge
    Cookies
    Apple cobbler
    Blondies
    Ice cream
    Cheesecake
    Carrot cake</p>

</div>

<span class="n">Fudge_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which of these desserts do you typically have at Thanksgiving dinner? <span class="n">Cookies_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which of these desserts do you typically have at Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply.   - Cookies"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">Apple_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which of these desserts do you typically have at Thanksgiving dinner? <span class="n">Blondies_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which of these desserts do you typically have at Thanksgiving dinner? <span class="n">Icecream_isnull</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Which of these desserts do you typically have at Thanksgiving dinner? <span class="n">dessert_ate_by_all</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Brownies_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Peach_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Fudge_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Cookies_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Apple_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Blondies_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Icecream_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Cheesecake_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">Carrotcake_isnull</span>

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="from-above-we-can-deduce-that-577-people-would-eat-one-or-more-of-the-above-dessert-and-481-would-not-eat-any-of-the-above-dessert.">from above we can deduce that 577 people would eat one or more of the above dessert and 481 would not eat any of the above dessert.<a class="anchor-link" href="#from-above-we-can-deduce-that-577-people-would-eat-one-or-more-of-the-above-dessert-and-481-would-not-eat-any-of-the-above-dessert.">¶</a></h1><h1 id="we-can-say-here-that-if-we-would-recommend-dessert-during-thanksgiving-we-can-fairly-recommend-any-or-all-of-the-above-where-one-can-make-his-choice.">we can say here that if we would recommend dessert during thanksgiving we can fairly recommend any or all of the above where one can make his choice.<a class="anchor-link" href="#we-can-say-here-that-if-we-would-recommend-dessert-during-thanksgiving-we-can-fairly-recommend-any-or-all-of-the-above-where-one-can-make-his-choice.">¶</a></h1><h1 id="the-question-would-be:-what-desserts-should-we-recommend-during-subsequent-thanksgiving?">the question would be: what desserts should we recommend during subsequent thanksgiving?<a class="anchor-link" href="#the-question-would-be:-what-desserts-should-we-recommend-during-subsequent-thanksgiving?">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>

Hence the remaining (70-43) 27 who work in retail do not work for an employer.<a class="anchor-link" href="#27-people-are-self-employed-working-as-a-retailer:-since-70-work-in-retail,-43-will-work-for-an-employer-on-black-friday,-and-all-43-do-work-in-retail.-Hence-the-remaining-(70-43)-27-who-work-in-retail-do-not-work-for-an-employer.">¶</a></h1>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#associating regional patterns in dinner menu</span>
<span class="c1">#we try to find what kinds of food are eaten by a kind of regional pattern</span>
<span class="c1">#this will help us know how to market the dish </span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">selectdish</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">region</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">dish_list</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"US Region"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">region</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dish_list</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">dishlist</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">selectdish</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"South Atlantic"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dishlist</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">return_intincome</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    
    <span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">" "</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s1">'Prefer'</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    <span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"$"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">","</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string_income</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">earn_count</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"How much total combined money did all members of your HOUSEHOLD earn last year?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#print(earn_count)</span>
<span class="n">income_integer</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"How much total combined money did all members of your HOUSEHOLD earn last year?"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">return_intincome</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"int_income"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">income_integer</span>
<span class="n">result_described</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"int_income"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#print(result_described)</span>
<span class="c1">#data["int_income"].value_counts()</span>
<span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pivot_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">values</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"int_income"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">aggfunc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[57]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?
Chicken                    40500.000000
Ham/Pork                   65370.370370
I don't know               16666.666667
Other (please specify)     79193.548387
Roast beef                 35625.000000
Tofurkey                   73235.294118
Turducken                 200000.000000
Turkey                     77113.543092
Name: int_income, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#from the above we can see that average income for those who eat Turducken is higher than those who eat Turkey</span>
<span class="c1">#hence we musnt conclude that it is because of income, rather it might be choice or likeness for the food</span>
<span class="c1">#though it is fine to hypothesize since Turkey is the next after Turducken...hence income could influence this as well</span>

<span class="c1">#looking at it based on cost: Turducken might be more expensive than Turkey and </span>
<span class="c1">#Turkey might be expensive than the other kinds of food, hence people went for dish their income could afford</span>

<span class="c1">#acording to a source: http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/blog/turducken-showstopping-holiday-roast</span>
<span class="c1">#turducken is a combination of deboned turkey, deboned chicken and deboned duck stuffed into each other and spiced and then</span>
<span class="c1">#cooked for about 5-7 hourse...who wouldnt say this might cost a lot, but it taste nice and your thanksgiving would still be talked</span>
<span class="c1">#about even after days to come...</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
